title: Had a probably not-good thought about a revised Guardian Angel.
body:
Will post it anyway because why not.

> _**Guardian Angel**_
> 
> _Chain Vest (800) + Negatron Cloak (720) + 880 = 2400_
> 
> +40 Armor
> +40 Magic Resist
> 
> Unique Passive: Upon taking lethal damage, you vanish for 0.5 seconds before becoming a Guardian Angel for 3 seconds. During this time, you become untargetable and are unaffected by abilities from allied champions, your abilities have no casting costs, and any damage you would deal (including True Damage) is reduced to zero.
> 
> Your champion's other "on taking lethal damage" effects will be activated once Guardian Angel ends.

The idea is supposed to be that you persist for a bit as an entity that can provide support and CC, but can't body-block or deal damage to anything in that state.

I just think this thing should be more utility oriented than just giving free lives to any AD champions that have the luxury of buying it. It's already obnoxious enough having Zilean around doing that.

replies.body:
Seems to defeat the purpose. Champions who have high utility wouldn't want to pay that for such minimal stats. The utility based champs are either tanks or supports. Supports have limited gold and need CDR and utility based items that activate before they die while tanks will want pure tank items and usually will just blow everything once they engage and essentially just sit there.

The point of GA is to give champs who thrive with continuous damage (like ADCs) a second chance should they get bursted down.

Then it would become an item for CC heavy heroes.  
Are you asking this for preference? Or because you think we lack viable items. Like is gargoyle plate not sufficient for this?

> [{quoted}](name=LilxPaprika,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NoqeFV9V,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-25T18:54:19.998+0000)
>
> Then it would become an item for CC heavy heroes.  
> Are you asking this for preference? Or because you think we lack viable items. Like is gargoyle plate not sufficient for this?

I guess if I had to list out what I thought:

- Having a short "second life" instead of a full-on revive means the item doesn't need its astronomical 5 minute cooldown where it kinda feels like dead weight in your inventory.

- Making it a resistance item (again) instead of an AD item so it's not a win-more item for any AD champion who's ahead enough to buy it. It's almost purely a luxury item because its build path isn't exactly good for most ADs that fall behind _(particularly if you can't afford the B.F. Sword it needs)_.

I don't think it's too big an issue if there's some overlap with Gargoyle Stoneplate. Plate is a proactive item, to reinforce against initial burst, while this item would give a tank an extra moment to help his team after he gets taken down. 

Plus, items that actually trade damage for utility never hurt.

_(Also, it seems to me like Gargoyle Stoneplate's mostly built for the Cho'Gath R one-shots, or on Sion because lul infinite HP.)_

> _(Also, it seems to me like Gargoyle Stoneplate's mostly built for the Cho'Gath R one-shots, or on Sion because lul infinite HP.)_

this could be fixed if it's not viable on enough champions, see this: 
https://docdro.id/qG5Y6Ka

it's a really long post I submitted to Gameplay + 

I'm not putting down your idea, I just don't think it's a necessity thing, more preference. 
then again fun factor is always a needed thing. so it might be more fun, and I could def see it at least tried in like aram or something. mix it up some.
Doesnt really sound like a guardian angel, but now it sounds like its a very vengeful angel.

> [{quoted}](name=LeftyRaydy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NoqeFV9V,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-25T18:44:11.777+0000)
>
> Doesnt really sound like a guardian angel, but now it sounds like its a very vengeful angel.

Well, I mean you get to be a sort of guardian angel for your team, impeding the enemy.

Honestly, if anything, Knight's Vow should've been called Guardian Angel because its effect is literally making you your partner's guardian angel.

I guess I just don't like the "win more" feel that the offensive version of GA has.
Guarding your partner by whooping dat ass
